diagnostic_features.name: Clear Cytoplasm
diagnostic_features.description: Tumor cells exhibit abundant clear cytoplasm due to glycogen and lipid content being dissolved during processing. This gives the cells a 'clear' appearance under H&E staining.

diagnostic_features.name: Delicate Vasculature
diagnostic_features.description: Numerous fine, arborizing capillaries create a 'chicken wire' or 'lace-like' vascular pattern between nests of tumor cells.

diagnostic_features.name: Cell Arrangement
diagnostic_features.description: Cells are arranged in nests, acini, or alveolar patterns surrounded by the aforementioned vasculature.

diagnostic_features.name: Nuclear Grade
diagnostic_features.description: Typically low to intermediate Fuhrman or ISUP nuclear grade; nuclei are round with smooth contours and inconspicuous nucleoli (Grade 1â€“2), but can be higher in aggressive forms.

diagnostic_features.name: Necrosis and Hemorrhage
diagnostic_features.description: In more aggressive or larger tumors, areas of necrosis, hemorrhage, or cystic degeneration may be visible.

diagnostic_features.name: Papillary Architecture
diagnostic_features.description: Tumor cells are arranged along fibrovascular cores, forming true papillae. These papillary fronds may contain foamy macrophages.

diagnostic_features.name: Foamy Macrophages
diagnostic_features.description: Abundant foamy histiocytes (lipid-laden macrophages) are commonly found within the fibrovascular cores of the papillae.

diagnostic_features.name: Psammoma Bodies
diagnostic_features.description: Round, concentrically laminated calcifications are frequently present in PRCC and serve as a useful diagnostic clue.

diagnostic_features.name: Cell Type
diagnostic_features.description: Two subtypes: Type 1 cells are small with scant pale cytoplasm and low-grade nuclei; Type 2 cells are larger with eosinophilic cytoplasm and higher nuclear grade.

diagnostic_features.name: Architecture Variability
diagnostic_features.description: Mixture of tubular, papillary, and solid growth patterns, especially in type 2 PRCC.

diagnostic_features.name: Cytoplasmic Features
diagnostic_features.description: Cells have pale, finely reticulated cytoplasm or eosinophilic granular cytoplasm, often described as 'vegetable cell-like' or 'plant cell-like'.

diagnostic_features.name: Cell Borders
diagnostic_features.description: Distinct, thickened cell membranes give the tumor a 'plant cell' appearance, with well-outlined cell borders.

diagnostic_features.name: Perinuclear Halos
diagnostic_features.description: Clear perinuclear halos are seen due to cytoplasmic clearing around the nucleus, possibly due to microvesicles or cytoplasmic organelle arrangement.

diagnostic_features.name: Nuclear Wrinkling
diagnostic_features.description: Irregular, 'raisinoid' nuclei with prominent nuclear wrinkling and irregular nuclear contours are a hallmark.

diagnostic_features.name: Architecture
diagnostic_features.description: Growth is typically solid, trabecular, or nested with minimal stroma. Some tumors exhibit a sheet-like architecture.
